poem:
### Diplomatic Table

On a morning where leaders mingle,  
words like borders blur,  
Rosh Hashanah sounds its new year echo.  
Trump in the glass halls, pondering maps,  
raised eyebrows at declarations floating  
like kites without strings.  
Underneath, a whisper—soon we'll talk of land  
like dreamers waking from the same dream.  
Here, two worlds poised on a hopeful pause.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump to meet with world leaders at UN general assembly as summit focuses on two-state solution – Middle East crisis live 8.02pm BST Danon doubled down that Israel will react to the wave of nations formally recognizing a Palestinian state. Asked what the reaction will be, he deferred to Benjamin Netanyahu’s government, and said it would be discussed after the Jewish new year (this year Rosh Hashanah falls today – Wednesday) and after Netanyahu returns". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Trump to meet with world leaders at UN general assembly as summit focuses on two-state solution – Middle East crisis live 8.02pm BST Danon doubled down that Israel will react to the wave of nations formally recognizing a Palestinian state. Asked what the reaction will be, he deferred to Benjamin Netanyahu’s government, and said it would be discussed after the Jewish new year (this year Rosh Hashanah falls today – Wednesday) and after Netanyahu returns
